That really isn't any different from your original question. So, as there are religions that are so vastly different, no I don't think there is anything we can all agree on. One thing that kills it is there are still polytheistic religions practiced. Not many, but there are still some. So, we all can't even agree on how many gods there are. So, maybe if you narrowed it down to Just Christians, Muslims, and Jews, then yes we could very easily agree on a lot, as they are all based on an Ancient Hebrew Religion.

 is there any one thing about god that any theist believes is absolutely true?

 
 Well, I'd say any theist would have to believe the divine exists in some form. So there IS something they all believe is true--that it exists.
 
 What I think needs to be said (before non-theists jump all over it) is that lack of consensus does not mean a weak position. In other words it doesn't mean theism is any less right or more wrong in general just because they have different views about God.

 its not my intention to attack theism simply because there is no consensus. i am interested in finding out if there is anything at all about god that makes him identifiable universally, so that if something occurs, everyone, or at least every theist, could agree that "yes, that is god/of god". there must be something that is common about all theists' view of god to even agree to share the term when describing the same idea. so there must be some commonality as far as the idea of god is concerned

 while this is off topic, ill address this breifly. religion is at the core of segregation and all the negativity associated. you see, god is usually associated with beneficial events (yes, i'm kinda answering my own question). so people who have relatively more good events happen to them (based on their perception of what beneficial is) feel that they are more favored of god than those who have had less fortunous events. since another common belief about god is that everyone in the earth is either god's friends or his enemies (no middle ground), those who are not favored of god must therefore be enemies of god. the friends of god, based on their black/white viewpoint, can feel justified that they are superior to the enemies of god. this feeling of superiority has a lot of anti-social repercussions, from isolation and alienation, to wars and ethnic cleansing. clearly, this is not a good thing, at least not for the ones being discriminated against or killed, but in the eyes of the religious, those heathens had it coming
 
 in my view, religion is very much to blame. but like i said, thats kinda off topic...

maybe i should reword the question:
 
 is there any one thing about god that any theist believes is absolutely true?
They all agree there is no God

 I was avoiding saying this, but since pappillion broke the ice, here goes:
 There is one thing and only one thing about god that all theists believe is absolutely true: god exists.
 The fact that this is the only thing about god that all theists can agree upon should tell you something.
